p: A year after cannabisativine was reported, the second spermidine alkaloid, namely anhydrocannabisativine ( 323), was isolated from the dry leaves and small stems of cannabis of the Mexican variety grown in Mississippi [ 111]. The compound was isolated through a series of acidâ€“base extractions and silica-gel chromatography. The identity of the compound was proven by spectral data analysis and by the conversion of cannabisativine ( 322) to anhydrocannabisativine ( 323). In 1978, the spermidine alkaloid was isolated from the roots and leaves of a Mexican variant [ 112]. In 1977, the Mississippi group also identified anhydrocannabisativine ( 322) in 15 different Cannabis variants using TLC eluted with chloroform: acetone: ammonia (1:1:1) [ 113].
